quoteFirst: No doubt more continued the line to the northward, but that was all that could be seen. The visibility having improved considerably as the sun descended below the clouds, we re-engaged at 7.17 P.M. and increased speed to 22 knots. At
quoteLast: my course was S.W., speed 18 knots, the leading enemy battleship bearing N.W. by W.
title: The Grand Fleet, 1914-1916
author: Jellicoe, John Rushworth, 1859-1935

quoteFirst: _7:20 P.M. Patient relapsed into coma. Pulse almost imperceptible....
title: Stopwatch on the world
author: Gilgannon, Daniel R.; Poulton, Peter, 1914-1972 [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: Willard held the face of his watch to the dim light that came from the open door of the hotel. “
title: Benton's Venture
author: Barbour, Ralph Henry, 1870-1944; Chickering, Charles R. (Charles Ransom), 1891-1970 [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: begins his southern journey; or, to put it astronomically, the sun enters _Gemini_, and summer begins, on June 21st, at 1:42 a. m. On the 1st, sun rises at 4:31 a. m., sets at 7:24 p. m.; on the 16th, rises at 4:29 a. m., sets at
quoteLast: ; and on the 30th rises at 4:33 a. m., sets at 7:34 p. m. Many persons judging from the temperature will be inclined to think on the 21st that the sun must be at midday directly above their head; but it will have an elevation of not more than 73°.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 05, June 1885, No. 9
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]

quoteFirst: No doubt more continued the line to the northward, but that was all that could be seen. The visibility having improved considerably as the sun descended below the clouds, we re-engaged at 7.17 p.m. and increased speed to 22 knots. At
quoteLast: my course was SW., speed 18 knots, the leading enemy battleship bearing NW. by W. Again, after a very short time, the enemy showed signs of punishment, one ship being on fire, while another appeared to drop right astern.
title: World's War Events, Vol. II
author: Reynolds, Francis J. (Francis Joseph), 1867-1937 [Editor]; Churchill, Allen L. (Allen Leon), 1873-1940 [Editor]
